intro: Phyllanthus dracunculoides, commonly known as the Indian spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant produces a milky latex when damaged, which is a common feature among members of its family. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it both ecologically significant and useful in traditional medicine.
